Summon your wind-up Kefka minion. Just can't believe it? Believe it!<tab>Other than a vague claim by Y'shtola that the doll you discovered in Omega's Sigmascape seems “eerily familiar,” none of your companions can recall ever hearing of a wicked jester known as Kefka, be it in history books or children's tales.<tab>Now, if you'll excuse me, I have an appointment with Kefka! - Locke Cole<tab>Forsaken<tab>Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your wind-up Magnai minion. Ever in search of true love.<tab>When, after countless moons, their most radiant brother could still not find a suitable wife, several of the Oronir visited Kugane to have poppets created in Magnai's likeness. As of this writing, the outspoken leader remains alone.<tab>You're not related or something, are you? - Lyse<tab>Angry Brother<tab>Delivers 10% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

Summon your aurelia polyp minion. Lighter than air─er...water.<tab>Hitching a ride in the ballast tank of a submersible proved an enlightening experience for this infant wavekin, allowing it to listen in on the incessant mumblings of the vessel's pilot─a mammet voyager tasked with taking an audio log of all discoveries made.<tab>Tonight we will feast on the jellyfish while my jealous fish of a brother drinks in his tears! - Nortmoen<tab>Irritating Tendrils<tab>Delivers 10 points of damage every second to all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s

Summon your Byakko cub minion. Got to be the fuzziest.<tab>While not the actual progeny of the thousand-year-old auspice lord, this eponymous recreation (in newborn form) is sought after by Hingans hoping to see their luck turn for the better.<tab>Genbu may be the oldest, but Byakko's got to be the fuzziest. - Kamaitachi<tab>White Courier<tab>Knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Fafnir minion. Protective eyewear highly recommended.<tab>Why the scholar who crafted this mechanical marvel felt that an already deadly dragon need carry a sword (and a legendary one, at that) remains unclear. When questioned, he simply refused to alter the design and began muttering about “drop rates.”<tab>Those hard scales, those claws...that puny body. Are you some kind of lesser dragon, kupo? - Mogzin<tab>Ridill<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 and knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Mithra minion. Opinions on how Miqo'te rate compared to their supposed ancestors are best kept to oneself.<tab>A stack of dusty tomes and a healthy imagination served as inspiration for this automaton designed to depict the Mithra─supposed ancestor of the Miqo'te. She wears a traditional scorpion harness rendered in painstaking—and pointless—detail by her Sharlayan creator.<tab>Looking to make a new frrriend, are we? - Nanaa Mihgo<tab>Mihgo's Amigos<tab>Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (40 if the ally is a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>poppet<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>). <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your Prince of Anemos minion. Cute and cudgely.<tab>Much to the chagrin of his father─the Lord of Anemos─the young heir has yet to outgrow the odd habit of concealing cudgels and using them to bludgeon anyone who dares question his merits. Thankfully, an absence of thew leaves his lively blows lacking.<tab>By the Twelve, what a hideous, monstrous abomination! - The Impresario<tab>Dipsy Duel<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Призовите своего миньона комаину. На половину лев, на половину пёс — левопёс!<tab>Полагают, что эти мифические левопсы охраняют места от злоумышленников, поэтому статуи этих мифических существ часто устанавливают у ворот священных мест, таких как храмы. В паре с похожим другим они всегда обращены лицом вперёд.<tab>Яркий, как лампа, смелый, как лев. —Хаермага<tab>Два щенка в одной кадке<tab>Обезвреживает установленные ловушки противника.

Summon your Gold Whisker minion. Beckons you to enter his barrel of sin, but don't go in.<tab>This gaudy rendition of a Namazu is not actually solid gold, but merely a wooden automaton adorned with gold leaf. Its creator, however, hopes that will be enough to fool trade ships from the West to import his “lucky catfish.”<tab>Within these whiskers lies unbound potential. - Old Namazu Master<tab>Ring My Bell<tab>Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

Summon your magic monkey minion. King of monkeys. Equal of heaven. Inspirer of “awww.”<tab>A miniature doppelganger of Qitian Dasheng magically brought into being by the ancient auspice himself. Originally used by the monkey king to cozen corrival and companion alike, now it merely serves to act adorable as it hovers nearby its new owner.<tab>It seems this year shall belong to the monkey after all! - Saru Doshin<tab>Jingu Bang<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

Summon your clockwork lantern minion. Hands-free illumination for the busy insomniac.<tab>Seeing as collaborations are now all the rage in Eorzea, it did not take long for the tinkers of Eshtaime's Lapidaries to find their way to Frondale's Phrontistery to see what madness their collective minds could conceive. (A lantern. They made a lantern.)<tab>They can scarce make do without their lanterns. - Armelle<tab>Light My Fire<tab>Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Activation Delay:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your frilled dragon minion. Also known as the <var 1A 02 /var>chlamydosaurus<var 1A 01 /var> but...uh, yeah.<tab>Tree-dwellers by nature, frilled dragons only descend to hunt, using their powerful rear legs to propel them forward at speeds that rival most Lalafell. When intimidated, they will spread out the spiked frills adorning their necks, hoping to frighten would-be predators.<tab>Are you some kind of lesser dragon, kupo? - Mogzin<tab>Desert Sprint<tab>Increases movement speed of all allies within range by 35%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your wind-up Cirina minion. Hungry for divine guidance. Also buuz.<tab>Commissioned for the Rising to promote interest in Xaela culture, this fully operational automaton was designed with painstaking detail, using the Mol youth Cirina as a model.<tab>She's braver than she looks. - Lyse<tab>Word of the Gods<tab>Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your wind-up Sadu minion. Will most likely not call any of your companions a stunted chuluu.<tab>There once lived a young Dotharli warrior who dreamed of taking the khatun into his arms and, well, doing things that young Dotharli warriors dream of doing. He quickly realized he valued his life and instead crafted this less imposing stand-in.<tab>Is the khatun woman or man? A stupid question. She is Sadu. - Koko<tab>Falling Dusk<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 300 to all enemies within range. The action party is immediately withdrawn from the playing field after execution.

Summon your copycat bulb minion. The only companion you need if you want no other companions.<tab>Swaddled in crimson cloth and transfixed with an all-too-familiar earring, this shambling seedkin─seemingly fallen from the infamously fetid Cassie─reeks of rotting rutabagas and sour spirits.<tab>The sapling is well on its way to becoming a tree. - Beatin<tab>Sickly Sweet Breath<tab>Binds all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 5s

Summon your wind-up Tarutaru minion. Remarks relating to a certain people's stature and the diminutiveness thereof are best kept to oneself.<tab>A stack of dusty tomes and a healthy imagination served as inspiration for this automaton designed to depict the Tarutaru─supposed ancestor of the Lalafell. She wears a gaudy vermilion cloak rendered in painstaking—and pointless—detail by her Sharlayan creator.<tab>Ages ago, there lived a female mage of no small repute who was known by all sorts of unsavory epithets. - Gerolt<tab>Refresh<tab>Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

Summon your wind-up Tsukuyomi minion. Barren waters, heed unto the tide.<tab>Conscripted into the imperial army, only to be handed over to Eorzean Alliance officials in an unreported prisoner exchange, one humble goldsmith celebrated his regained freedom how most goldsmiths do─he crafted a lifelike replica of the Lady of the Moon, Tsukuyomi.<tab>And I am but the moon. - Lebrassoir<tab>Nightbloom<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Zhloe minion. Cannot thank you enough, but will certainly try.<tab>Impressed with Zhloe's tireless efforts at the orphanage, a craftsman employed by Rowena's House of Splendors created an automaton version of the altruist and gifted it to her sister, Khloe...who silently added it to her table of rewards.<tab>But deep down, I knew that Mummy and Daddy were never coming back. - T'kebbe<tab>Fresh-baked Flatbread<tab>Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>poppet<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>).

Summon your Construct 8 minion. Batteries not included.<tab>Inoperative when discovered in the Clockwork City of Goug, the queer device whirred to life when a crystal was inserted under its chest plate. As long as the crystal is not replaced with auracite, the automaton should prove harmless.<tab>A construct born of desperation and denial. - Penitent Heretic<tab>Compute<tab>Delivers an attack 5 times the potency of the caster's ATK.

Summon your Palico minion. Very punny.<tab>Hailing from a land so distant it does not appear on any map, this catlike hunter has traveled to far eastern Othard in pursuit of his quarry─the fire-breathing Rathalos. How he came to fight by your side is a story better told over a roast leg of wyvern.<tab>They allowed him to bring the sum of his skills to bear...or maybe <var 1A 02 /var>cat<var 1A 01 /var>, on his foes. - Gerolt<tab>Coral Orchestra<tab>Increases ATK of all allies within range by 25. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your Poogie minion. Beloved by hunters, though the feeling is not always mutual.<tab>Many a hunter from lands both near and far has proclaimed this tiny piglet “cute enough to eat.” Not literally, of course. Alright, sometimes literally, but not this time. There will be no eating of Poogie, and that is final.<tab>Ungodly swine! I would sooner <var 1A 02 /var>die<var 1A 01 /var> than surrender to you! - Vault Priest<tab>Dig<tab>Disarms deployed enemy traps.

Summon your attendee #777 minion. Wasshoi, yes, yes.<tab>Gyoshin labored through several nights to fincraft this tiny Namazu (though the happi stitchwork is clearly Gyorei's). He intended to make it in the likeness of the 777th attendee, but soon lost count, so model selection was ultimately random.<tab>I am happy to have met some- one so delici─deft of hand. - Cirina<tab>Dawn of Civilization<tab>Increases DEF of all allies within range by 20. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your scarlet peacock minion. Prettier than your average peacock, and several times as flammable.<tab>Peafowl have long been admired in the Far East for their brilliant plumage, but it is their penchant for hunting venomous vilekin that has earned them reverence typically reserved for kami. As such, effigies of the birds are believed to bring their owners good fortune.<tab>There will come a time when we must confront Suzaku. - Genbu<tab>Scarlet Dreams<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 80 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your wind-up Alpha minion. Kweh-ing along under some distant sky.<tab>Crafted at the Garlond Ironworks, this miniature reproduction of your faithful (if not somewhat deformed) companion was gifted to you by engineer Jessie Jaye upon your triumphant return from the Alphascape.<tab>Well, Alpha certainly seems keen. - Cid<tab>Teleport Tag<tab>Transports action party to the central summoning Gate.

Summon your OMG minion. Weird. Technological. Fascinating.<tab>Despite a striking resemblance to the extra-dimensional mechanical monstrosity that nearly ended your life, this miniature model of Omega does naught but follow in your wake. Wedge of the Garlond Ironworks posits it may have been created to observe your behavior.<tab>Soon, Omega, soon... I will see you rise again! - Nero tol Scaeva<tab>Targeting<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 to all enemies within range while inflicting a weakness to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>monsters<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your wind-up G'raha Tia minion. The future is where his destiny awaits.<tab>In order to fund the expedition to the Syrcus Trench, Tataru crafted this series of automaton, modeled upon a certain Archon, the tales of whom she heard from Rammbroes.<tab>A man could study for two lifetimes and only learn half of what you know. - Cid<tab>The Good Eye<tab>Renders ally Gates, Shield, and Search Eye impervious to damage. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s

Summon your Little Yin minion. Turn around.<tab>One half of a pair of (literally) animated decorations you stumbled across during the All Saints' Wake festivities. Members of the Continental Circus are at a loss as to why this sullen specter appears to have a will of its own, though “possession” is high on their list of theories.<tab>Are we really sleepin' at a graveyard? 'Cause I'm afraid of ghosts... - Hal<tab>Devilish Dispel<tab>Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

Summon your Little Yang minion. Every now and then he gets a little bit closer.<tab>One half of a pair of (literally) animated decorations you stumbled across during the All Saints' Wake festivities. Members of the Continental Circus are at a loss as to why this spry specter appears to have a will of its own, though “possession” is high on their list of theories.<tab>Everyone'll think you a ghost! - Erapi Taropi<tab>Villainous Vanish<tab>Renders action party immune to all attacks. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your wind-up Cloud minion. Sharp hair, don't care.<tab>At first glance, it appears that the artisan took numerous liberties in this rendition of the legendary hero─the distinct lack of upper-body muscle mass suggesting Cloud would have been unable to even lift a weapon the size of the Buster Sword, let alone brandish it over his head.<tab>...something. - Cloud<tab>Finishing Touch<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 380 to all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Aerith minion. The future ith not only yourth.<tab>A somber reimagining of the ill-fated flowermonger who would set off on a journey to discover herself, only to find more than she bargained for. What is wind-up can never die.<tab>This guy are sick. - Aerith<tab>Great Gospel<tab>Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>critters<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 5s

Summon your wind-up Tifa minion. Not the wrong person.<tab>A gravity-defying rendition of the legendary bartending brawler, carved with tender loving care by a seven-fingered craftsman who is oft overheard mumbling to himself, “Words aren't the only way to tell someone how you feel.”<tab>Fu, fu, fu... Be nice, Don. - Tifa<tab>Final Heaven<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 and knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your mudpie minion. At last, portable filth.<tab>A thick, brown mass of living effluence squeezed forth from one of the horror Tokkapchi's many hidden orifices. Though the squirt stinks of sopping sod, one might find themselves pressed to deny the amorphous alluvium is anything but adorable.<tab>I was almost certain you'd want to muddy the waters. - Jessie<tab>Muddy Waters<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 60 to all enemies within range while reducing movement speed by 70%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your bridesmoogle minion. What is a blushing bride without a dutiful bridesmoogle to scatter petals in her general vicinity?<tab>Moogles serving the Sanctum of the Twelve claim the magicked poppets (provided with purchase of a lavish Ceremony of Eternal Bonding) are guaranteed to bring happiness. Conveniently offer no refunds if you do not hap upon said happiness.<tab>Wh-What have you done with my bride!? - Vannes<tab>Never the Bride<tab>Increases ATK of all allies within range by 10. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your wind-up Elvaan minion. Remarks relating to a certain people's perpetually dour facial expressions are best kept to oneself.<tab>A stack of dusty tomes and a healthy imagination served as inspiration for this automaton designed to depict an Elvaan─possible (but improbable) ancestor of the Elezen. He wears a blue cotehardie rendered in painstaking—and pointless—detail by his Sharlayan creator.<tab>Curious pointed ears... I wonder where they could have come from, kupo? - Mogleo<tab>Fan Dance<tab>Increases action party DEF by 40. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your dhalmel calf minion. Oddly short yet alarmingly tall.<tab>Considering this young specimen was most likely bred in captivity for the purpose of research, it is nothing short of a miracle that the calf has managed to survive the harsh environment of Eureka for as long as it has.<tab>Yes, you─with the long neck. - Tsukumo<tab>Cold Stare<tab>Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

Summon your capybara pup minion. Loves bath time, and you.<tab>Known in Hingashi as the “onitenjikunezumi” (quite liberally translated as “Near Eastern demon rat”), this rodent auspice of unknown age has developed a fondness for Far Eastern hot springs, and will spend days in the restorative waters if not reminded to come out and eat.<tab>Such simple creatures, rats. - Charibert<tab>Bucktooth<tab>Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

Summon your Conditional Virtue minion. Cuddle not to dullness; coddle not to elevation.<tab>From a pulsating mass of aetherial flesh sloughed off the Eurekan elemental Absolute Virtue did rise this uncanny facsimile, identical to its progenitor in every way─every way, that is, except size and, well, absoluteness.<tab>Men measure virtue in many ways. - Yayaroku<tab>Last Virtue Standing<tab>Increases caster ATK by 10 and DEF by 5 for every 5% of HP lost. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your yukinko snowflake minion. Falling, falling, falling, falling, falling...falling on his head.<tab>The yukinko's woven headdress serves not only to protect the creature from the elements, but spare it the embarrassment of having its nakedness exposed unto the world─not that any sane man would dare peek under the straw, lest he risk eternal damnation.<tab>It is the enemy that weighs on me─snow, rather than fire. - Martiallais<tab>Snozzle<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 70 to all enemies within range while reducing movement speed by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your dress-up Tataru minion. Say what you will, she wears it well.<tab>To thank those adventurers who have come to her aid while in Kugane, Tataru Taru of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn has been presenting her knights in shining armor with handcrafted replicas of...herself, fully clad in the finest silks from Bukyo.<tab>Tataru's expression grows ever darker each time I see her pass by. - Slafborn<tab>Scion Song<tab>Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your wind-up weapon minion. Somewhat buggy.<tab>Scaled-down replicas of armored weapons have long been mass-produced by the Garlean Imperial Army in an effort to train new recruits in the proper methods of magitek deployment and repair.<tab>Be on your guard─ he's known to be armed! - Brass Blade<tab>Short-range Sensory Jammer<tab>Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 260 to all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Activation Delay:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your wind-up Qalyana minion. She may or may not break through the borderline.<tab>The ex-Gatekeeper who crafted this doll claims her model was a Qalyana battlemaid who awoke from her reverie to join Alpa in the headstrong Vira's endeavor to protect the realm. She hopes it serves to strengthen the bond 'twixt the Ananta tribes.<tab>The Qalyana are another Ananta tribe─the strongest and the most influential. - M'naago<tab>Tail Thwap<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 and knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Redback minion. Don't tell mom the Kojin minion's red.<tab>A master craftsman hailing from the Kojin of the Blue conceived this miniature automaton with the hopes that it might one day bring together his clan and the Kojin of the Red. How exactly an automaton might do that has yet to be determined...<tab>I'm a giant tortoise! A tortoise! - Soroban<tab>Kasaya<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 80 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 10%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your minitek conveyor minion. The latest in miniature transport technology.<tab>It is not in Garlean nature to leave well enough alone, and so imperial magitek engineers crafted miniature versions of their mountable conveyor unit. However, through some design flaw, the automaton atop the belt appears highly susceptible to possession by voidsent.<tab>Thankless job, carrier is. - Ehcatl Nine Carrier<tab>Hijack<tab>Binds all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 8s

Summon your wind-up Fran minion. Stilettos guaranteed not to impede progress through markedly rough terrain such as jungles, bogs, and abandoned monasteries serving as prisons for extra-dimensional forces of evil.<tab>Taking a page from the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, Bangaa fusilier Rinok secretly commissioned the creation of scores of miniature Fran fetishes in an effort to fill the coffers of the perpetually under-funded resistance movement spearheaded by Lente's Tears.<tab>Fran is not too bad, once you're on her good side. - Rinok<tab>Feral Strike<tab>Reduces HP of enemy Shield by 70%. No effect if Shield is already inoperable.

Summon your wind-up Nu Mou minion. So cuddlesome it hurts.<tab>Designed in the likeness of a former member of Clan Nutsy, this automaton appears so cuddlesome as if it were made of cotton. Most folk think twice about cuddling it, however, when they learn it was actually made by a Nu Mou claybender using mud and mushroom spores.<tab>A ring, a ring, a wondrous thing, when its metal band hides a Nu Mou's sting!♪ - Nee Marn<tab>Fitting Payment<tab>Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

Summon your Seitei minion. Dragon-ness is in the eye of the beholder.<tab>While the true Seiryu has been documented as being more serpent than dragon, this replica of the azure auspice bears a striking resemblance to Kirin (though assurances have been made that this design decision was by no means a cost-cutting measure).<tab>Hurry up and knock some sense into Seiryu's noggin! - Kamaitachi<tab>Monster Party<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

Summon your zephyrous zabuton minion. More pushing for another cushion.<tab>It is well documented that Hingans shun chairs, preferring instead to sit upon the floor. What is less known, however, is that when a speaker utters something deemed clever, she is rewarded with cushions that she may sit in a position elevated above her peers.<tab>We would be singing of mending socks and sitting on cushions. - The Wandering Minstrel<tab>Out from Under<tab>Transports action party to the central summoning Gate.

Summon your abroader otter minion. Hobbies include playing and having fun on an island in the sun.<tab>Legend tells of a right mad otter who, dissatisfied with the fare of his home waters, bought a ship and made south for more bountiful seas. There, he ate like a king...until his boat sank in a storm, leaving the slippery pup alone on stranger tides.<tab>He seemed...odd. Well, odder than usual. - Cocobezi<tab>Surf's Up<tab>Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s

Summon your hedgehoglet minion. Only your selfless love and affection can keep him blissfully dilemma-free.<tab>For centuries, hedgehogs have been considered a delicacy in the Far East, their succulent flesh supped upon by prince and pauper alike. An influx of Western traders more interested in keeping the pups as pets, however, has all but put an end to this grisly tradition.<tab>I need not explain what a needle is, I trust? - Redolent Rose<tab>Acupuncture<tab>Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

Summon your brave new Y'shtola minion. Not wont to run from her troubles─and couldn't get very far, anyway.<tab>Lovingly crafted by the Night's Blessed, this tiny mechanical Y'shtola─“Master Matoya,” to some─wears the black garb that marks her a member of their community, and bears a deadwood rod symbolizing her commitment to driving back the Light.<tab>Did you really think I would go gently into that dark night with so much left undone? - Y'shtola<tab>Matoya's Mystique<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Ryne minion. Not merely a palette swap.<tab>With hair of spun gold and eyes of clearest sapphire, this young maiden was an incarnation of Minfilia, by whose name she was known. In the course of her journey, however, she chose to take her destiny into her own hands, and with it came a new look, name, and automaton likeness.<tab>What about... Ryne? - Thancred<tab>Minfilia's Power<tab>Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s

Summon your black hayate minion. Gaze upon the visage of a ruthless killer.<tab>Despite their endearing appearance, black hayate are oft employed as guard and sheep dogs, as they react to threats with shocking ferocity. It was for this reason that the breed was named after a piece of lethal weaponry from its eastern homeland, now lost to the Flood.<tab>They expected hounds on their trail and I sssent them a dragon! - Eshana<tab>Hound Oath<tab>Increases action party ATK by 40. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 15s

Summon your chameleon minion and marvel as it melts into your surrounds.<tab>By channeling aether into its crystal-coated scales, the chameleon can alter its appearance to blend into the surrounding environment in a mechanism not unlike that of glamour prisms. For its penchant for adopting new looks, it has earned a reputation as the “glamourous scalekin.”<tab>Oh, I suggest nothing so glamorous. - Nero tol Scaeva<tab>Invisible<tab>Reduces HP of closest enemy Gate by 50%. No effect if Gate is already inoperable.

Summon your wind-up Fuath minion. Markedly less murderous than the real thing.<tab>Though this clockwork automaton─magically rendered waterproof for amphibious adventuring─possess no heart in which to harbor malice, the fact that it was created at the hands of <var 1A 02 /var>real<var 1A 01 /var> Fuath is cause enough to wonder what tricks it may be hiding up its tiny sleeve.<tab>The first rule of dealing with the Fuath...is do <var 1A 02 /var>not<var 1A 01 /var> deal with the Fuath. - Ardbert<tab>Jolly Good Sport<tab>Sets a trap that, when triggered, reduces the movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Activation Delay:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your armadillo bowler minion. Possessed of a superior sense of balance.<tab>Armadillos are seldom caught without their rocks, which they use to defend themselves from enemies. As a large rock bespeaks strength and status, one may occasionally see bravado-bound beasts that unwisely choose something beyond their ability to lift.<tab>Who was that armored devil!? - Alphinaud<tab>Ball Up<tab>Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>monsters<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your Great Serpent of Ronka minion. Tremble, child of man, for a creature of purest divinity wiggleth before thee.<tab>This creature, Quinfort insists, is none other than the all-seeing, all-powerful Great Serpent of Ronka. Though its wobbly girth may deceive the eye, that is, presumably, a mere mark of the serpent's mercy, for its true form would be too terrible for mortal minds to comprehend.<tab>Screee! - The Great Serpent of Ronka<tab>Lost Secret<tab>Increases action party movement speed by 30%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your micro gigantender minion. Is it small or is it big? You be the judge.<tab>Though known for their prodigious size, gigantenders come into the world small and grow ever so slowly. This creature is estimated to be between twenty and thirty years of age, which by gigantender standards is still considered young. The oldest known creatures are said to live beyond two centuries.<tab>In another three hundred years, I'll be bigger and stronger than you will ever be! - Ohl Deeh<tab>1000 Flowers<tab>Delivers 8% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

Summon your clionid larva minion, small on size but massive on appetite.<tab>A relative of the sea slug, the clionid feeds on plankton early in life. As it matures, however, it begins consuming flesh in order to satisfy its voracious appetite, and uses the tentacles extending from its head to latch onto prey. For now it follows you obediently. For now...<tab>What a delicious morsel! I wanna get my tentacles around her... - Ultros<tab>Buccal Cones<tab>Reduces HP of enemy Search Eye by 90%. No effect if Search Eye is already inoperable.

Summon your bitty duckbill minion. Do not attempt to put on your feet.<tab>Named for its duck-like bill, this creature hunts not by sight or smell, but rather by sensing the aetheric discharge from prey. It can also deliver a potent venom from the spurs on its hindfeet, causing great pain if not death─a sobering contrast to its adorable appearance.<tab>Aren't you just the most adorable little thing!? - Jessie<tab>Venomous Spurs<tab>Delivers 20 points of damage every second to all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 15s

Summon your Eden Minor minion. Free of sin, though not for lack of trying.<tab>In a demonstration of its godlike power that may be generously termed “unfathomable,” Eden created this tiny being in its image. Fortunately, the amount of aether Eden Minor can manipulate is so minuscule that, despite its best efforts, it poses little danger to the world at large.<tab>For what was once shattered may be forged anew. - Ryne<tab>Eternal Breath<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 380 to all enemies within range.

Summon your giant beaver minion, a mystery better left unsolved.<tab>A mysterious being that appeared at Phisor Lran. Whatever may be the truth of its identity, some mysteries in the world are better left unsolved. Let it be enough that everyone has their heart's desire...<tab>Something tells me that's one more mystery better left unsolved. - Ellie<tab>Squeal<tab>Instantly restores damaged ally Shield.

Summon your wind-up Suzaku minion, complete with her flute and her senses.<tab>Upon hearing the tale of his compatriot Soroban's adventures, a Kojin dollmaker was moved to honor the Four Lords, guardians of the Ruby Sea. This recreation of Suzaku is one of the fruits of his efforts, masterfully capturing the essence of the legendary auspice.<tab>If anyone can make Suzaku see reason, it's you. Good luck! - Senri<tab>Twinkling Interlude<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 110 to all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Omega-M minion to observe your irrational behavior.<tab>This automaton is the work of a goldsmith who desired to explore new definitions of beauty. Upon delivering a batch to the House of Splendors, the man is said to have declared, “To understand the one, one must understand the other. For their beauty lies in the whole.”<tab><bleep> hELLo, WOrlD!?<tab>Resonance M<tab>Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (40 if the ally is wind-up Omega-F). <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your wind-up Omega-F minion to test the efficacy of combat role allocation.<tab>This automaton is the work of a goldsmith who desired to explore new definitions of beauty. When an engineer of Garlond Ironworks went to question the man about how he came upon his subject matter, he is said to have abruptly vanished, as if swallowed into the Interdimensional Rift.<tab>Initiating system shutdown...<tab>Resonance F<tab>Increases ATK of all allies within range by 20 (60 if the ally is wind-up Omega-M). <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your tinker's bell minion. Said to be named for a pixie...unless you ask the pixies, who adamantly deny that any of their kind would ever have borne such a ludicrous name.<tab>Discovered fallen off the monstrous Archaeotania by an Ondo youth, this enigmatic instrument, half-bell and half-maiden, is believed to be either an adornment from ancient times or a recreation thereof. Upon it is inscribed an enchantment that amplifies magical power.<tab>How do you measure half a bell anyway? - Mauto<tab>Enigmatic Note<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your tiny echevore minion. Its tail tastes like nectar...but you wouldn't know such things.<tab>The scales on this critter's back are arranged in such a way as to put one in mind of the succulent echeveria. Lying concealed in tall grass, it lures insects with its tail, which secretes a sweet-tasting fluid akin to nectar.<tab>I shall enjoy sucking on its tail for that sweet, sweet nectar taste! - Overzealous Nu Mou<tab>Taste of Nectar<tab>Grants action party the ability to deal extra damage to Arcana Stones. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your sharksucker-class insubmersible minion. Warning: do not immerse.<tab>Built by a mammet voyager in a moment of boredom, this clockwork ship raises several questions about machine ethics by its very existence. Another, perhaps more significant question it raises is, “Why build a functioning model submersible and not make it watertight?”<tab>Not water! Anything but water! - Zahar'ak Hatchling<tab>Torpedo<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 120 to all enemies within range while increasing action party ATK by 20. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your shoebill minion, an unflappable bird possessed of a regal air...or perhaps simply a condescending one.<tab>Common to Kholusia, the shoebill is known for being literally unmoving. Its hunting effort consists of waiting for prey to wander by its feet before it deigns to strike. For reasons unknown, it saw fit to accept you as its master, and now follows you wherever you go...with the bare minimum of exertion.<tab>Love can move shoebills. - Ancient Ballad<tab>Regal Air<tab>Reduces ATK of all enemies within range by 40%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your butterfly effect minion. Illusory and therefore incapable of invoking any history-shattering consequences...right?<tab>There is a theory which states that the fluttering of a butterfly's wings may give rise to a raging storm a thousand malms away. This crystal has nothing to do with that theory; rather, it is said to simply be the work of a priest of Ronka, created during a bout of boredom.<tab>Take wing, ye souls of war! - Ravana<tab>Butterfly Effect<tab>Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

Summon your ironfrog ambler minion, a darling, diminutive, dwarven-made...automaton.<tab>This diminutive automaton is designed to automatically load itself with the ore which serves as its energy source. However, the function appears to be overactive, resulting in it compulsively checking whether the ore is present. The wind-up key is a purely aesthetic addition.<tab>A-digging we will go! - Korutt<tab>Soul of Mining<tab>Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

Summon your forgiven hate minion. Having repented its sins, it poses no danger.<tab>A sin eater-esque something or other found on Mt. Gulg. Though it follows you relentlessly, as if driven by hate, it can do little save flutter about and occasionally unravel itself. There seems to be no harm in keeping it with you for now...<tab>I'm just going to assume that cube is an eater. - Thancred<tab>Trigger and Push<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 and knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your bacon bits minion. Tastes like bacon...if bacon and clay taste the same to you.<tab>After seeing a dream wherein they were being followed by a flying pig, a retainer out gathering absent-mindedly worked some clay into the creature's likeness. To their surprise, the creature suddenly sprang to life─most likely at the hands of a pixie bent on mischief.<tab>I am curious as to what mischief the flying pig has in mind... - Sue-Rend<tab>Porky Puff<tab>Removes all effects from all enemies and allies within range.

Summon your wind-up pixie minion. Won't make mischief at your expense─pixie's honor.<tab>The Dreamspinners present this mammet as a gift to those children whom they have befriended. Unlike a real pixie, it doesn't make mischief, so you don't need to constantly be looking over your shoulders.<tab>Come and play with us... - Titania<tab>Pixual Healing<tab>Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>poppet<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>).

Summon your mystic weapon minion. Only slightly cursed.<tab>While out on a venture, your retainer discovered a timeworn blade and took it in their hand...whereupon a peculiar creature manifested. Though the weapon was believed to be cursed, the retainer was reportedly not concerned, as it was to be given to you in any case.<tab>I ain't got the patience for no mystic rubbish today. - Gerolt<tab>Smite of Rage<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

Summon your meerkat minion. Keeps an eye out for danger while basking in the sun.<tab>Native to lands bordering the Sea of Ash, these small beastkin dwell in underground colonies, emerging from their burrows as the sun rises in order to bask in the warmth. Curiosity brought this creature to a submersible undergoing repairs on the shore, and it hasn't looked back since.<tab>I am rather looking forward to basking in the sunshine of her praise. - Emmanellain<tab>Sunbathe<tab>Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

Summon your miniature white knight minion. Aids in the purging of sickness. Or not.<tab>Crafted by the Skysteel Manufactory, this mammet was originally conceived for the Temple Knights to use in their strategizing, its mobility allowing for greater realism in battle simulations. Programmed to seek out formidable opponents.<tab>Only a knight errant may break a stalemate. - Drillemont<tab>Underclock<tab>Increases action party DEF by 40. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your Cute Justice minion. Rocket Punch parts may present a choking hazard. Not for children under the age of two.<tab>Lovingly crafted by an ex-Illuminati scientist now in the employ of the Garlond Ironworks, this colorful toy version of Brute Justice is composed of multiple pieces cast in solid zinc so that it may stand against even the most rambunctious of children.<tab>Verdict: Guilty. Punishment: Eradication! - Brute Justice<tab>Block-building Threat<tab>Changes action party auto-attacks to area of effect attacks. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 12s

Summon your domakin minion. Close, but not a warrior with the body of a mortal and soul of a dragon.<tab>Reeled in by your retainer, this delightfully plump fish was created by a Doman goldfish enthusiast, its name a portmanteau of his nation and the local word for gold. It floats in the air by virtue of the cloudsbreath seeds it devoured, though how it manages to breathe is unknown.<tab>Quite a catch indeed! - Nortmoen<tab>Flashy Fins<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 and knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your dress-up Estinien minion. Sun-dried squid not included.<tab>A mammet fashioned in the likeness of the Azure Dragoon Estinien following his retirement from service. Created for the purpose of educating the younger generation about the Dragonsong War, it has been distributed to places of learning throughout Ishgard.<tab>I find myself less and less inclined to sear your squid! - Orn Khai<tab>Dragon-seared Squid<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 120 to all enemies within range while increasing action party ATK by 20. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your little leannan minion. Doesn't see you as food. Yet.<tab>Having just recently sprouted, this leannan young still possesses a mild temperament, but as its demands for nutrients grow, it will begin to hunt men and beasts alike. In preparation for this, it has already begun practicing its skills of enthrallment.<tab>Seeds know no borders; they will sprout wheresoever the earth embraces them. - Martineau<tab>Spring Breeze<tab>Reduces HP of closest enemy Gate by 60%. No effect if Gate is already inoperable.

Summon your wind-up hobgoblin minion. Crafted in the likeness of your mother...or so certain dwarves would say.<tab>Contrary to what certain dwarves may claim, the hobgoblin upon which this mammet was based is no relation of yours; rather, it was a creature that was haunting your retainer's dreams. By crafting this minion and gifting it to another, they hoped to pass on the nightmare.<tab>Your mother was a hobgoblin! - Giott<tab>Goblin Punch<tab>Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 270 to all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Activation Delay:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your Cerberpup minion. With three wet little noses and three sets of adorable staring eyes, what's not to love? Aside from all of the teeth, obviously.<tab>This peculiar creature was found in a dark corner of a storehouse belonging to House Haillenarte. As voidsent are not uncommon in the wilds of Coerthas, it was at first thought to be a lesser such monstrosity, but─aside from the three heads─it appears to be an ordinary pup.<tab>We'll see if our bite's worse than our bark. - Hilda<tab>Hell Charge<tab>Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

Summon your pod 054 minion. The perfect assistant for adventuring...or it would be, if it worked properly.<tab>Dug up in the depths of a factory fallen to ruin, this diminutive white machina was apparently designed to provide tactical support to a YoRHa. Though equipped with myriad functions, from support fire to advance conversation, none of these are operational at present.<tab>Machines are not to be trusted, least of all those that can think. - Estinien<tab>A014: Point Up<tab>Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

Summon your pod 316 minion. The perfect assistant for adventuring...or it would be, if it worked properly.<tab>Dug up in the depths of a factory fallen to ruin, this diminutive black machina was apparently designed to provide tactical support to a YoRHa. While most of its functions are no longer operational, it remains determined to attend the object of its support.<tab>Machina are mighty and can smite muchly, yes, but they need fuel. - Softknox<tab>R014: Speed Up<tab>Increases movement speed of all allies within range by 35%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your sungold Talos minion. Guaranteed to make you the envy of collectors and younglings alike.<tab>During its heyday, Daedalus Stoneworks created this miniature Talos, which boasts true-to-life detail and a premium gold overlay. It proved so popular, the story goes that, to meet demand, the company had to recruit master gilders from all over Norvrandt.<tab>A much smaller Talos from our company could just as easily perform the same task! - Chai-Nuzz<tab>Golden Crush<tab>Reduces HP of closest enemy Gate by 90%. No effect if Gate is already inoperable.

Summon your Malone minion. If it weren't following you around, it would be tearing hapless adventurers apart on the Diadem.<tab>A young prehistoric creature found on the Diadem, whose unforgiving environment forged its kind into ruthless predators. For reasons unknown, it saw you as friend instead of food, and began following you. Ever ravenous, it snaps at its own tail whenever it comes into view.<tab>There are too many of them. Too many dinosaurs for us to face alone! - Vath Braveheart<tab>Spinnosaurus<tab>Increases movement speed of all allies within range by 35%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your little leafman minion. Definitely a leafman. The pixie said so.<tab>This curious being was found amongst the wares peddled by a pixie playing merchant. While it does bear resemblance to the leafmen scattered across Il Mheg, that it is able to move raises eyebrows, but inquiring after the reason only elicits impish laughter from the pixie.<tab>We're going to get along like a leafman on fire, I just know it! - Uin Nee<tab>Bush Bash<tab>Increases ATK of all allies within range by 25. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your Behelmeted Serpent of Ronka minion. Tremble, child of man, for a creature of purest divinity wiggleth before thee in all of its behelmeted glory.<tab>This incarnation of the Great Serpent of Ronka is said to have appeared before the Stewards and directed them to restore the broken Qitari stela. Though equipped with a mining helm, the all-seeing divinity obviously has no need of such mortal contrivances to navigate dark caverns.<tab>Scree! Scree! - The Behelmeted Serpent of Ronka<tab>Lost Curse<tab>Delivers 10% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

Summon your Behatted Serpent of Ronka minion. Tremble, child of man, for a creature of purest divinity wiggleth before thee in all of its behatted glory.<tab>Seeking to honor the Great Serpent of Ronka, the Stewards recreated the stylish ensemble it was once observed sporting, and made an offering of it to one of the divinity's incarnations gracing the Stopple. All agree that the outfit brings out the stately serpent's adventurous aspect.<tab>Screee-eee! - The Behatted Serpent of Ronka<tab>Lost Mystery<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 to all enemies within range.

Summon your silver dasher minion. Never was there a bird so adorable.<tab>This little bird suddenly appeared inside the hold of a submersible, in all likelihood wandering in when the mammet pilot surfaced the vessel and opened the hatch for fresh air. It has since gone on to charm everyone with its adorable appearance and antics.<tab>Oh, isn't it adorable? - Jihli Aliapoh<tab>Adorable Twitter<tab>Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 15s

Summon your paissa patissier minion. Currently in training as a culinarian, and looks the part.<tab>This paissa young was found amongst supplies sent from Camp Cloudtop. As punishment for pillaging the victuals, it was put to work in the kitchens, where it surprised everyone by demonstrating an aptitude for the culinary arts. The caramel milk tea it makes is to die for.<tab>They don't come much curiouser than the paissa. - Noelle<tab>Taste of Infinity<tab>Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

Summon your paissa threadpuller minion. Currently in training as a weaver, and looks the part.<tab>When mysterious embroidery began appearing on the garments of her Rose Knights, Lady Laniaitte set out to uncover the perpetrator. Her surveillance led to the capture of this paissa young, which was made to work in Ishgard's restoration as punishment, though it appears happy enough.<tab>Death by ungainly paissa... thought mortifies Vanu worse than forgetting sundrop dance! - Eenu Vanu<tab>Weave of Infinity<tab>Removes all detrimental effects from all allies within range.

Summon your ancient one minion. Small and appearing to be fractured, but whole.<tab>This lifelike miniature of an ancient was recreated from a small concept crystal discovered in Anamnesis Anyder. Though believed to have been some manner of toy, given the towering stature of the ancients, its size is comparable to that of a Lalafellin child.<tab>The challenge of deciphering the wisdom of the ancients is a researcher's dream. - Y'mhitra<tab>Bewilderment<tab>Renders all allies within range immune to attacks by <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>critters<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 5s

Summon your Major-General minion. It's a shark. With legs.<tab>“Many heads are so passé. Legs are the wave of the future,” someone did say. Little did they know that there already were sharks that possessed not only legs, but arms besides. How these killing machines came to be, however, is a question left unpondered if you value your sanity.<tab>To think I almost 'ad ye fed to the sharks! - Rhoswen<tab>Feeding Frenzy<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 90 and knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your amaro hatchling minion. It may make a fine steed if you live long enough to see it reach maturity.<tab>This infantile amaro's wings are not yet strong enough to lift it more than an ilm or so off the ground, try as it might. Given enough time around people, it may gain the gift of speech, but with you for a master, that process may be somewhat delayed...<tab>Oh, how I envy the amaro. In all of creation, no animal is so pure, so perfect... - Bethric<tab>Ways of Ronka<tab>Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your Laladile minion. Because small is beautiful.<tab>Unlike its monstrous cousins, this scalekin grows no more than a few fulms long and is docile besides. Once favored as a pet by Ishgardian nobility, who named it for the affable Lalafellin folk, it is known to befriend other creatures such as small birds.<tab>Never fuss over a sarcosuchus. - Traditional Children's Song<tab>Charmed Life<tab>Renders ally Gates, Shield, and Search Eye impervious to damage. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s

Summon your unlucky rabbit minion. Has known the bitterest lows and the sweetest highs.<tab>Born of an idea proposed by Godbert Manderville, this leporine mammet proved tremendously popular in Ul'dah, but questions of ownership rights led to it serving as the mascot of the Platinum Mirage for a spell. It eventually returned to the Gold Saucer after legal matters were settled.<tab>The damn things reproduce faster than rabbits in heat. - Raganher<tab>What's Up<tab>Increases action party movement speed by 30%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your Lalinator 5.H0 minion. It doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear. And it absolutely will not stop, ever, until you have been lali-ho'd.<tab>Wishing to improve his lackluster lali-hoing, Ronitt created this automaton in secret to be his practice partner. Boasting precision movement and powered by dwarven ethanol, it performs rousing lali-hos the equal of any dwarf worth his ale.<tab>A “lali-ho” gets a “lali-ho,” you hear? - Giott<tab>Lali-ho<tab>Binds all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 5s

Summon your wind-up Mystel minion. Modeled upon no one in particular. No, really.<tab>Desiring to honor a certain individual with a mammet likeness but knowing that it would go against his wishes to do so, the artisans of the Crystalline Mean came up with the perfect solution: make a mammet likeness anyway but give it a vague name. That makes everything all right...right?<tab>By any other name, I would still be a rose! - Masked Rose<tab>Wisdom of Allag<tab>Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (30 if the ally is a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>poppet<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>). <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your wind-up Ardbert minion. What he lacks in size, he makes up for in heart...and his disproportionately large axe.<tab>This mammet was created to honor Ardbert, the hero who fought to save the First as a Warrior of Light and Darkness both. His spirit lives on in all who has ever thought to lend a helping hand to his fellow man.<tab>As brightly as a hero's tale shines, it is not without its shadows. - The Wandering Minstrel<tab>Hero's Pledge<tab>Renders ally Gates, Shield, and Search Eye impervious to damage. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s

Summon your magitek helldiver F1 minion. Minimal firepower, maximum attitude.<tab>Although a single-rider flying machina like the sky armor, the helldiver is an entirely different beast to handle due to its fundamentally distinct design. Thus were such scale models produced, that would-be pilots might study their flight dynamics prior to taking the helm.<tab>Did that man just bring down flying armor with a single stroke <var 1A 02 /var>in midair<var 1A 01 /var>? - Aymeric<tab>Air Gun<tab>Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

Summon your weatherproof gaelicat minion. Makes you feel toasty warm simply to behold it.<tab>It is theorized that the gaelicat's garb is no garb at all, but an extension of its corporeal form. That this specimen appears to be wearing a winter coat is the result of its adaptation to Coerthan climes, while its ample girth came about via a more mundane process: overeating.<tab>There is no creature so heavenly as the cat! - Feline Fanatic<tab>Fluff-housing<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 80 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 13%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your ephemeral necromancer minion. If it could, it would summon forth an army of equally adorable undead.<tab>As a token of gratitude for playing with them, a pixie created for you this miniature version of the spectral necromancer, the hero from a distant world whom you fought. Whoever that mysterious maiden may have been, her tale may never be known.<tab>If you go and die on me, I'll pay a necromancer to raise you from the dead so I can kill you out of spite! - Renda-Rae<tab>Necromancy<tab>Instantly restores damaged ally Shield.

Summon your Allagan melon minion. Capable of movement and tremendously juicy.<tab>Since ancient times, melons have been favored in many cultures as nature's drinking flask. Not satisfied with merely their thirst-quenching property, however, Allagan scientists set out to make them portable, and this self-propelled melon is the fruit of their labors.<tab>And you say his muscles swelled to bursting, like firm melons ripening in the summer sun!? - Company Muscle<tab>Melon Mine<tab>Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 270 to all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Activation Delay:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your sand fox minion. Will perform tricks for a lick of birch syrup.<tab>The descendant of a thousand-year-old vulpine spirit, this creature dreamed of training under the tutelage of its legendary forebear, Sotan. Alas, it was turned away, and ended up taking you as its master instead. Though it will devour most anything you give it, it has grown fond of birch syrup.<tab>You can't smoke out a fox with hot air. - Bran<tab>Burrow<tab>Disarms deployed enemy traps.

Summon your petit pteranodon minion. It might be cute now, but wait till it grows and becomes a scourge of the skies.<tab>Abandoned by its parents, this pteranodon young was discovered by an Ishgardian botanist during a foray on the Diadem. Though initially aloof, through regular hand-feeding it grew fond of people, and was placed in your care that it might become a worldly sort of prehistoric creature.<tab>When is a dinosaur not a dinosaur? - Folk Riddle<tab>Glide<tab>Increases action party movement speed by 30%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your Dáinsleif F1 minion. Does not form the head. Or any other part of the body, for that matter.<tab>Following the success of the magitek avenger, imperial scientists looked to various other creatures for inspiration in designing their next warmachina, this feline automaton being the test model for their studies into quadrupedal carnivores.<tab>They're fierce carnivores, who see steel-clad knights as nothing more than a packed lunch. - Alexondre<tab>Magitek Fang<tab>Reduces HP of enemy Search Eye by 90%. No effect if Search Eye is already inoperable.

Призовите своего друга йо-кая Короля Энма. Последний в череде королей, вершивших судьбу мира йо-кай.<tab>В нем живёт душа одного отважного юноши и йо-кая огромной с огромной силой.<tab>Вперёд!<tab>Сильнейший взрыв Энма<tab>Наносит атаку с силой 230 всем врагам в радиусе действия.

Призовите своего друга йо-кая Короля Ананта. Новый правитель мира йо-кай.<tab>Когда-то он был соперником отрёкшегося от престола Короля Энмы, но стал его надёжным союзником и другом.<tab>Да начнётся же наш путь!<tab>Змеиная волна<tab>Снимает все полезные эффекты со всех противников в радиусе действия.

Призовите своего друга йо-кая Зазеля. Советник Энмы, короля йо-каев.<tab>Вместе с Энмой, ушедшим с поста великого короля, он преследует тьму, таящуюся в мире демонов.<tab>Мой господин!<tab>Судебная волна<tab>Даёт 10 очков действия всем союзникам в радиусе действия, у которых нет аналогичных действий.

Призовите своего друга йо-кая Демонессу. Принцесса родившаяся среди преисподней.<tab>Принцесса в маленькой стране посреди преисподней. Обладает невероятной силой, но не испытывает эмоций.<tab>Время пришло.<tab>☆Сияющий хаос<tab>Вредит своим врагам и понижает их показатели тёмной силой (связывает их в радиусе). <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Длительность:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 5 сек.

Summon your 2B automaton minion. For when you need the company of a compact version of an advanced combat android dressed in a distinctive subculture style.<tab>Recovered from deep within the Puppets' Bunker, this diminutive automaton bears a resemblance to the android known as YoRHa No.2 Type B. Why such a thing was created and by whom, however, are questions that will likely remain unanswered.<tab>So there're androids, which are machines, but also other machines, and also... - Dig Site Chief<tab>One Battle Ends<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 and knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your 2P automaton minion. For when you need the company of a compact version of an advanced combat android dressed in a distinctive subculture style.<tab>Though this automaton found within the Puppets' Bunker bears a resemblance to the android known as YoRHa No.2 Type P, it thankfully doesn't appear to be hostile. Created through unknown technology, how it operates is a complete mystery.<tab>Not that I'm not eager to take apart an android, but...how do we...do that? - Konogg<tab>The War Rages On<tab>Reduces action points of all enemies within range by 50% of the maximum value.

Summon forth your much-coveted Mora minion. Few wavekin have ever been the object of so much anticipation, only to be followed by such crushing disappointment.<tab>The bane of many an ocean fisher, the Momora Mora exhibits all the qualities of much rarer and more desirable catches...until it is hoisted out of the water.<tab>Fishing's like philanderin'─ ye never know what ye'll catch! - Wawalago Momolago<tab>Something Bites<tab>Transports action party to the central summoning Gate.

Summon your Syldrion-class insubmersible minion. Unlike the craft on which it is modeled, it will break immediately upon coming into contact with water.<tab>Despite being an incredibly realistic replica of a Syldra-class submersible, it lacks any such aquatic capabilities. It is, however, able to hover in midair for a seemingly limitless amount of time, which is considerably more impressive.<tab>I'll stick to swimming, thank you very much. - Alisaie Leveilleur<tab>Cannon Salvo<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 230 to all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Gaia minion. Those who think the hammer is just for show had best watch their toes.<tab>Supposedly discovered by those investigating the Empty, its appearance there is both inexplicable and implausible. Considering all the other unlikely events that occurred there, however, perhaps the sudden materialization of a hammer-wielding mammet is not so unusual after all.<tab>Let me get this straight. You came to talk to me about <var 1A 02 /var>biscuits<var 1A 01 /var>? - Gaia<tab>Hellacious Hammer<tab>Reduces HP of closest enemy Gate by 60%. No effect if Gate is already inoperable.

Summon forth your wind-up Palom minion. Try not to break it.<tab>Based on one half of a pair of twin mages, this charming minion brings an air of mischief wherever it goes. The tales say that the real Palom mastered the dark arts by the age of five, though one has to question whether teaching dangerous magic to small children is such a good idea.<tab>Something stinks. - Palom<tab>Bluff<tab>Increases DEF of all allies within range by 20. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon forth your wind-up Porom minion. The rosy cheeks and pronounced eyelashes indicate that this is the female half of a matching pair.<tab>Created in the likeness of Porom, twin sister to Palom. According to legend, they were sent by the elder of their village to aid in an epic quest to save the world, which seems like a bit of a tall order for two five-year olds. Perhaps the other mages had more important matters to take care of?<tab>This isn't a picnic we're going on, Palom. - Porom<tab>Cry<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon forth your wind-up Edge minion. Based on one of the few people who had the chance to be a prince <var 1A 02 /var>and<var 1A 01 /var> a ninja, which seems like too much fun to squeeze into one lifetime.<tab>Legends tell of Edward Geraldine, the ninja prince who assumed the name Edge, presumably because it sounded more impressive. Rumors have it that “Edward” was already taken by another figure in the tale, and there cannot be two people sharing the same name─it just gets confusing.<tab>You think our rage...a weakness? Then let me show you how wrong you are! - Edge<tab>Ninjutsu<tab>Increases ATK of all allies within range by 25. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon forth your wind-up Rydia minion. Not to be confused with a sprig of broccoli.<tab>According to myth, Rydia went missing as a child only to reemerge a short while later as a woman grown. How she later came to be immortalized as a miniaturized mammet is unclear, though her voluminous bright green hair is said to be very true to life.<tab>That was an awfully fast recovery. - Rydia<tab>Summon<tab>Instantly restores damaged ally Shield.

Summon forth your wind-up Rosa minion. Based on the central corner of a one-sided love triangle, if such a thing is possible.<tab>Rosa is said to have been blessed with both powerful healing abilities and an unerring bow arm. Unfortunately, these were of little use on the occasion she came close to being either sliced by a guillotine or crushed by an iron ball, depending on which version of the tale one hears...<tab>Please, Cecil...Be alive! - Rosa<tab>Pray<tab>Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>poppet<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>).

Summon your Save the Princess minion. For every person who has ever dreamed of owning a wheeled, spindly legged, trumpet-blowing mammet, there is this wheeled, spindly legged, trumpet-blowing mammet.<tab>Discovered deep in Delubrum Reginae, this bizarre contraption is believed to have been modeled after a much larger but equally bizarre contraption that once protected the ancient Bozjans from the Allagan Empire. The mystery of the trumpet, however, has yet to be solved. <tab>How is our little princess doing? - Serendipity<tab>By Not-so-royal Decree<tab>Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

Summon your Drippy minion. With a will to wander the world, one wonders whether said world will welcome this well-meaning watery whelp. <tab>This young nixie began life as rainwater that fell in Abalathia's Spine, and later found its way to Matoya's Relict via the Thaliak River. Having witnessed its elder kin summarily dispatched by the Warrior of Light, it decided to follow the age-old adage of “If one cannot beat them, one must needs join them.” <tab>Is this water!? Blah! Bluh! Bleh! - A Bewildered Amalj'aa<tab>Drip Tide<tab>Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

Summon your Trike minion. Very affectionate, but be prepared to make a quick sidestep if it comes running to greet you.<tab>Rescued from the Diadem by Aurvael de Haillenarte after falling sick from eating poisonous berries. The count's son would rather this tale not be discussed openly, particularly the part about him delving into a pile of fresh dung to ascertain the cause of the disease.<tab>That is one big pile of shite. - Aurvael's Assistant<tab>Trike Spike<tab>Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies within range.

Summon your golden beaver minion. Remember: all that glitters is not gold. Sometimes, it is a beaver.<tab>Whether this creature is a beaver turned into gold, or gold turned into a beaver is anyone's guess. It is said to appear in the passages of Lyhe Ghiah at the very moment one's heart's desire is fulfilled. Given the location, that would generally involve some sort of treasure.<tab>No, anything but beavers! - Tyr Beq<tab>Curse of the Golden Beaver<tab>Reduces HP of enemy Shield by 70%. No effect if Shield is already inoperable.

Summon your gull minion. Has a keen eye for finding schools of fish─and unguarded meals.<tab>In a quest to find more food with less effort, this La Noscean gull took to following the fishing vessel <var 1A 02 /var>Endeavor<var 1A 01 /var>. Its resourcefulness earned it the respect of the ship's captain and crew, and it was made an honorary member of the Fishermen's Guild.<tab>I swear, if another one takes a shite on my hair, it'll be seagull stew for dinner tonight! - V'kebbe<tab>Fish Finder<tab>Increases movement speed of all allies within range by 35%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your anteater minion. Definitely not a man-eater, otherwise that's what it would be called...right?<tab>Thanks to its voracious appetite, this young anteater has grown to a size to rival an adult Lalafell. Though appearing to otherwise be harmless, in certain parts its kind is said to prey on seasonal workers─and the men specifically─thus earning it the moniker of the Widowmaker.<tab>I'll never find a wife at this rate. - Gales<tab>Widowmaker<tab>Reduces DEF of all enemies within range by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 15s

Summon your dolphin calf minion. Has more intelligence in a single winsome flipper than you do in your whole body.<tab>A Sharlayan biologist once stated that dolphins are the second-most intelligent species on the star. It was later noted that, regarding the most intelligent, the man made no comment. Sensing impending doom, this calf has attached itself to you in hopes of finding a way to flee to safety.<tab>So long, and thanks for all the fish. - Dolphinkind<tab>So Long<tab>Reduces movement speed of all enemies within range by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 5s

Summon your magitek predator F1 minion. Comes complete with pilot and stands ready to wreak havoc among the enemy's ranks.<tab>This miniaturized model of an imperial warmachina was found among the forces of the Telophoroi laying siege to Paglth'an. By all appearances a toy of Garlean make, it is unclear how it managed to make its way to the southern reaches of Eorzea.<tab>Smash and burn their little toy, we will! - Ixali Chieftain<tab>Melee Claws<tab>Reduces HP of enemy Search Eye by 90%. No effect if Search Eye is already inoperable.

Summon your Senorita Sabotender minion. Like a thousand adorable needles piercing your eyeballs.<tab>One of the coveted prizes on offer at the Gold Saucer, the Senorita Sabotender is the charming niece of the iconic Senor Sabotender. Each example is said to be lovingly handcrafted by the realm-renowned goldsmith and park proprietor, Godbert Manderville.<tab>Sabotenders do not shake! - Nanaphon<tab>Senorita<tab>Reduces minion summoning recast time by 50%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your Benben stone minion. For when you need the top stone of a pyramid scampering around after you.<tab>Long ago, the men of Meracydia built great stone monuments in the image of Benben, a mound of myth whose name means “eternity.” This object is the top piece of such a structure, but none can say how it came to be in the dark depths of a faraway sea─or why it has legs.<tab>Our legends will echo in eternity! - Dorys<tab>On High<tab>Delivers 5% damage to the nearest enemy Arcana Stone.

Summon your wanderer's campfire minion. Perfect for driving away the darkness and the chill and, most importantly, toasting marshmallows.<tab>Couldn't strike a fire if your life depended on it? Sick of lugging around backbreaking loads of firewood on the off chance you need to camp out, but couldn't be bothered to gather the stuff at the end of a long, weary day? Introducing the wanderer's campfire!<tab>Few things compare to the simple pleasure of sitting beside a crackling campfire of one's own making. - Alphinaud<tab>Warmth<tab>Restores 200 HP to all allies within range (250 if the ally is a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>gadget<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>).

Summon your smaller stubby minion. A little rusted but still fit for purpose...whatever that may be.<tab>Discovered on the upper levels of the Tower, this tiny lifeform resembles the short-legged machines that occupied the selfsame structure. Though it follows you relentlessly, scans the area menacingly, and punches vigorously, it appears to mean you no harm.<tab>Nothing but lumps of rust if you ask me. - Moogle<tab>Attack<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 30 and knocks back all enemies within range.

Summon your wind-up Lyna minion. Don't forget to salute, or you're liable to receive a dressing-down.<tab>In her cups at the tavern one night, Lyna agreed to let a dwarven craftsman create mammets in her likeness. Though she claims no memory of the incident, it can't be denied that the result is a masterful recreation of the good captain, down to the rousing salute.<tab>Lyna does not strike me as one who enjoys being made to wait. - Alphinaud<tab>Captain's Resolve<tab>Increases action party DEF by 40. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your wind-up Runar minion. Because a single Runar pining for Master Matoya isn't enough.<tab>Designed in the likeness of Runar, this mammet was created to celebrate the signing of a trade agreement between the Night's Blessed and the Crystarium. In its pocket is a single white blossom, that the man can express his undying devotion to his beloved even if he is a world away.<tab>Please, Runar, dry your tears. What would the others think if they saw you like this? - Master Matoya<tab>White Blossom<tab>Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

Summon your wind-up Gunnhildr minion. Protects her people as a queen, a god, and now a mammet.<tab>Created in the likeness of Queen Gunnhildr, this mammet was found clutching a slip of paper bearing the words: “At journey's end, I discovered a new love...only to have it vanish with the ephemeral light.” In its mannerism, one cannot help but sense something familiar...<tab>The will of Queen Gunnhildr shall not be denied. - Misija<tab>White Queen<tab>Sets a trap that, when triggered, reduces the movement speed of all enemies within range by 70%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Activation Delay:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your 9S automaton minion. For when you need the company of a compact version of an advanced combat android dressed in a distinctive subculture style.<tab>Recovered from the upper levels of the Tower, this diminutive automaton bears a resemblance to the android known as YoRHa No.9 Type S. What thoughts drove him and his kind, and to what end did they risk all in their fight? The answers to such questions may never be found...<tab>Not a boy, an android. - 2P<tab>Fleeting Tenderness<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 120 to all enemies within range while increasing action party ATK by 20. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your Rudy minion. Eager to help, though perhaps not suited to guiding sleighs.<tab>Having served dutifully as one of the saint's little helpers, Rudy returned to his home deep in the mountains. But thanks to a Starlight miracle, a wandering saint succeeded in recreating a minion of the fellow so lifelike, it breathes.<tab>Why, it's a Starlight miracle! - Amh Garanjy<tab>Starlight Present<tab>Delivers an attack with a potency of 150 to all enemies within range while reducing DEF by 30%. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s

Summon your squirrel emperor minion. At once more powerful and adorable than a certain simian king.<tab>Fond of mortal children, the auspice Rissai once transformed himself into a learned man and taught the young ones their letters. Like the real auspice, this self-created avatar goes wherever the winds of philanthropy and delicious sweets blow.<tab>Thanks to predation by other rodents, only the fittest and most vicious of squirrels survive to adulthood. - Hunter-scholar<tab>Schneeball Eater<tab>Sets a trap that, when triggered, delivers an attack with a potency of 180 to all enemies within range. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Activation Delay:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 10s

Summon your Flag minion. A little reindeer with a huge appetite.<tab>So named for its fluttering tail, this adorable reindeer calf boasts a prodigious appetite that belies its size. Especially partial to corn, it threatened to devour clean a farmer's entire harvest, forcing the man to beg your retainer to take it away.<tab>I'm in no mood to be fawned over. - Greinfarr<tab>Glutton<tab>Restores 100 HP to all allies within range (150 if the ally is a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>critter<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>).

Summon your wee Ea minion. Proof that you don't need to be big to think big.<tab>In order to rearrange their jumbled thoughts, the Ea are known to temporarily shed a small part of themselves. In this instance, however, said part took on a will of its own and embarked on a journey of contemplation.<tab>My, how thoughtful! - Cirina<tab>Epiphany<tab>Doubles the amount of HP restored to allies stationed in Gates. <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 20s

Summon your wind-up Magus Sisters minion. Essentially three minions for one, so it represents great value.<tab>The Magus Sisters are revered deities in Thavnair, and their images are popularly peddled in Radz-at-Han as talismans. Able to move about freely and perform impressive acrobatics, this set of the three divinities counts among the more premium offerings.<tab>All right, teamwork! - Medrod<tab>Delta Attack<tab>Grants 10 action points to all allies within range who do not have similar actions.

Summon your optimus Omicron minion. Minimum proportions, maximum performance.<tab>As part of an initiative to downsize themselves, the Omicrons created this miniaturized, full-featured unit as a test prototype. Alas, the siege matrix Stigma-4 ceased to function shortly thereafter, and it never reached the mass production stage.<tab>I prefer foes to be more compact like myself─tiny, puny, compact. - 269th Order Mendicant Da Za<tab>Defense Protocol<tab>Increases DEF of all allies within range by 10 (30 if the ally is a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>monster<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>). <var 48 F201F8 /var><var 49 F201F9 /var>Duration:<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> 6s
